sn42.2:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn42.2:4.2: Then Tāḷapuṭa the dancing master came up to the Buddha,
sn42.2:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn42.2:4.5: “Sir, I have heard that the dancers of the past who were teachers of teachers said:
sn42.2:4.6: ‘Suppose a dancer entertains and amuses people in a stage or theater with truth and lies. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of laughing gods.’
sn42.2:4.7: What does the Buddha say about this?”
sn42.2:4.16: And for a third time Tāḷapuṭa said to the Buddha:
sn42.2:4.17: “Sir, I have heard that the dancers of the past who were teachers of teachers said:
sn42.2:4.18: ‘Suppose a dancer entertains and amuses people in a stage or theater with truth and lies. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of laughing gods.’
sn42.2:4.19: What does the Buddha say about this?”
sn42.2:5.1: “Clearly, chief, I’m not getting through to you when I say:
sn42.2:5.2: ‘Enough, chief, let it be. Don’t ask me that.’
sn42.2:5.4: When sentient beings are still not free of greed, and are still bound by greed,
sn42.2:5.5: a dancer in a stage or theater presents them with even more arousing things.
sn42.2:5.6: When sentient beings are still not free of hate, and are still bound by hate,
sn42.2:5.7: a dancer in a stage or theater presents them with even more hateful things.
sn42.2:5.8: When sentient beings are still not free of delusion, and are still bound by delusion,
sn42.2:5.9: a dancer in a stage or theater presents them with even more delusory things.
sn42.2:5.10: And so, being heedless and negligent themselves, they’ve encouraged others to be heedless and negligent. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the hell called ‘Laughter’.
sn42.2:5.11: But if you have such a view:
sn42.2:5.12: ‘Suppose a dancer entertains and amuses people in a stage or theater with truth and lies. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of laughing gods.’ This is your wrong view.
sn42.2:5.13: An individual with wrong view is reborn in one of two places, I say:
sn42.2:6.1: When he said this, Tāḷapuṭa cried and burst out in tears.
sn42.2:6.2: “This is what I didn’t get through to you when I said:
sn42.2:6.5: “Sir, I’m not crying because of what the Buddha said.
sn42.2:6.6: But sir, for a long time I’ve been cheated, tricked, and deceived by the dancers of the past who were teachers of teachers, who said:
sn42.2:6.7: ‘Suppose a dancer entertains and amuses people in a stage or theater with truth and lies. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of laughing gods.’
sn42.2:6.9: As if he was righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark
sn42.2:6.10: so people with good eyes can see what’s there,
sn42.2:6.11: so too the Buddha has made the teaching clear in many ways.
sn42.2:6.12: I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the Dharma, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
sn42.2:6.13: Sir, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence?”
sn42.2:6.14: And the dancing master Tāḷapuṭa received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence.
sn42.2:6.15: Not long after his ordination, the mendicant Tāḷapuṭa …
